Name: Sōryū
Namesake: Japanese: 蒼龍, meaning "Blue (or Green) Dragon"
Fate: Scuttled during the Battle of Midway, 4 June 1942
Displacement:
16,200 tonnes (15,900 long tons) (standard)
19,100 tonnes (18,800 long tons) (normal)
Range: 7,750 nmi (14,350 km; 8,920 mi) at 18 knots (33 km/h; 21 mph)
Armament:
6 × twin 12.7 cm (5 in) dual-purpose guns
14 × twin 25 mm (1 in) AA guns
Aircraft carried:
63 (+9 reserve)
21 Mitsubishi A6M Zero
18 Aichi D3A
18 Nakajima B5N (7 Dec. 1941)[1]
